clinical_study.brief_title: Retinal Nerve Fiber Layer Thickness and Cerebrospinal Fluid Aβ/Tau
clinical_study.official_title: Association of Retinal Nerve Fiber Layer (RNFL) Thickness With Cerebrospinal Fluid Aβ and Tau Concentration

brief_summary.textblock: To test the hypothesis that retinal nerve fiber layer (RNFL) thickness is correlated with Aβ and Tau concentration of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in an older population.

detailed_description.textblock: retinal nerve fiber layer (RNFL) thickness changing has been reported in Alzheimer's Disease (AD) patients at an early stage, and has been demonstrated as a potential biomarker able to predict cognitive deterioration (Hinton DR et al., N Engl J Med 1986; London A et al. Nat Rev Neurol 2013; Chang LY et al., Alzheimers Dement 2014). However, whether RNFL thickness is correlated with cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) features of AD pathogenesis (e.g., Aβ and Tau) remains unclear. The investigators thus conducted this observational cohort study to test the correlation between RNFL thickness changing and CSF, to further validate RNFL as a potential AD biomarker.

primary_outcome.description: Neuropsychological test battery to assess specific cognitive function, including immediate memory, visuospatial memory and executive function.

secondary_outcome.description: Optical coherence tomography (Carl Zeiss Meditec, Inc., Dublin, CA, USA) to measure RNFL thickness

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the spinal anesthesia before the administration of the local anesthetic.
secondary_outcome.description: ELISA kits (Aβ40: Cat. # 292-62301; Aβ42: Cat. # 296-64401, Wako, Richmond, VA) to measure Aβ concentration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the spinal anesthesia before the administration of the local anesthetic.
secondary_outcome.description: ELISA kits (Tau: Cat. # KHB0041, Invitrogen, San Francisco, CA) to measure Aβ concentration
Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) to assess global cognitive function

arm_group.description: The studied cohort were participants 60 years old or older, without a diagnosis of dementia, and scheduled to have orthopedic or urological surgery under spinal anesthesia at Shanghai 10th People's Hospital.

intervention.description: All participants were scheduled to have elective total hip or knee replacement surgery, ureteroscopic lithotripsy and transurethral resection of the prostate under spinal anesthesia at the Shanghai 10th People's Hospital

biospec_descr.textblock: 1 ml of CSF was collected from a spinal needle by anesthesiologists during the spinal anesthesia before the administration of the local anesthetic. The CSF was collected in an Eppendorf tube and was immediately stored in a -80 °C degree freezer until the time of measurement.

study_pop.textblock: A total of 201 old adults who were scheduled to have elective total hip or knee replacement surgery, ureteroscopic lithotripsy and transurethral resection of the prostate at the Shanghai 10th People's Hospital were asked to participate in this study. A total of 104 participants were enrolled from August 2013 to December 2014, and the data from 95 participants were finally included in the study.
